competitors.name: AMD (Advanced Micro Devices)
competitors.notes: Intel's biggest competitor in x86 microprocessor market; top x86 manufacturer second to Intel

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Key player in GPU market; expanding into data centers, AI, and machine learning

competitors.name: Samsung
competitors.notes: Competing in semiconductors; would surpass Intel as largest semiconductor maker by revenue in 2017-2018

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Competes with own processors in servers and mainframes

competitors.name: TSMC
competitors.notes: Competed with Intel for Apple chip fabrication contracts (2011-2015)

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Telecommunications and semiconductor manufacturer; mobile processor dominance

competitors.name: ARM
competitors.notes: UK-based company focused on energy-efficient processor design

competitors.name: Freescale Semiconductor
competitors.notes: Embedded processing solutions; acquired by NXP for $11.8B in June 2015

context: By 2015, Intel faced intensifying competition. Samsung emerged as a major threat. Intel competed with TSMC and Samsung for Apple chip fabrication contracts. Intel acquired Altera in 2015 for programmable logic devices.
